result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:04 AM Defendant Angela M Racanelli in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Angela M Racanelli. Defendant Angela M Racanelli in court.  Attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for State of Wisconsin.

Defense states they are ready to proceed to trial, receipt of blood results may effect jury trial. Defense requests an additional jury status hearing.

State advises that it has been in contact with the crime lab, but has not received blood results yet, and also requests another jury status hearing. 

Court sets another jury status hearing.

Hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

8:30 AM Defendant Angela M Racanelli in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Angela M Racanelli.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Andrea Will in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Waukesha County Deputy Bryan Skaar sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Will.  Cross examination by Atty. Hughes.  States rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Will moves for bind over.  Atty. Hughes objects to bind over. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:52 AM Defendant Angela M Racanelli in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Angela M Racanelli.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case called for bail/bond hearing. 

Defense makes arguments in support of request to reduce bond from $15,000.00 to $1,500.00. Defense states that the Defendant is currently on a DOC hold, and that the DOC is pursuing a revocation.
State confirms that the DOC is pursuing a revocation. State makes arguments in opposition to any modification of bail. 

For reasons stated on the record, the court denies the motion to modify bail. 

Case remains as set for preliminary hearing on 09/12/2022.
Bail/bond hearing on September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Motion to Modify Bail, filed by Atty Hughes

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 08/25/2022 requesting a bail reduction.

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 08/29/2022 - Defendant needs to work with their Attorney to file the proper Motion.**

ADDRESS INFO for Angela M Racanelli
Current: C/O Waukesha Co Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-23-2022)
Prior: 2016 Mckenna Blvd, Madison, WI 53711

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Defendant ordered to CAM monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services for 90 days or following program protocol for those that are low risk, unless otherwise ordered by the court. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM monitoring.

3:02 PM Defendant Angela M Racanelli in court, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Angela M Racanelli. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.
